title: Create a list of Snowplow events emitted from the frontend
description:
### Spreadsheet with data

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1CwChRvItO64e7OmDnUqLgOXjt61MUDGJcRtICGLo7-Q/edit

- It has three tabs: "Vue", "HTML" (Vue + HAML), and "Raw JS".
- "Vue" tab has two additional columns, "uses data" (`TRUE` if there is a `tracking` Vue property) and "uses directive" (`TRUE` if using the directive tracking wrapper); these two gives us insights about preferred usage.
- "HTML" has an additional "HTML tag" column that holds the element that fires the event. This is important because this method dispatches the event on `click`, `show.bs.dropdown` or `hide.bs.dropdown`. With dropdowns, it fires the event when opening and closing, adding `_show` or `_hide` to the action string correspondingly. If the [HTMLElement](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement) has a value property, it's used as the `value` for the event.
- Fields that use variables are wrapped into square brackets (`[variableName]`).
- Fields that have an optional value are prefixed with a ? (`?[mightBeEmpty]`)
- Fields that have values separated by pipes are [ENUM-like](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enumerated_type) fields (`on | off | n/a`)


### Conclusions

- All tracking calls are pointing to the [Tracking](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js) class.
- Usage is not wrong, but there are cases with some invalid [`trackStructEvent` properties](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/snowplow.html#structured-event-taxonomy).
- Events fired using *Raw JS* takes more liberties. The second place would be the *Vue directive*. Events fired using *data-attributes* and *mixins* seem to respect the taxonomy more.
- A good topic for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/issues/10480 would be "How to fix invalid event payloads", and some of the questions to answer might be (we should clarify this to the docs as well):
    - What is the naming convention for `action`?
    - Is `category` a namespace?
    - Is `label` the name of `property`?
    - Is `property` the name of `value`?
    - What can `value` hold?

#### Methods used for tracking
| FROM   | METHOD               | METHOD DEFINITION                                                                                              | EXAMPLE                                                                                                                                    |
|--------|---------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Vue    | mixin                     | [app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L141](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L141)             | [app/assets/javascripts/authentication/two_factor_auth/components/recovery_codes.vue#L82](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/authentication/two_factor_auth/components/recovery_codes.vue#L82) |
| Vue    | data-attributes           | [app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L117](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L117)                     | [app/assets/javascripts/blob/pipeline_tour_success_modal.vue#L125](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/blob/pipeline_tour_success_modal.vue#L125)                        |
| Vue    | directive                 | [app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/directives/track_event.js](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/directives/track_event.js) | [app/assets/javascripts/monitoring/components/dashboard_actions_menu.vue#L185](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/monitoring/components/dashboard_actions_menu.vue#L185)            |
| HAML   | data-attributes           | [app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L117](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L117)                     | [app/views/groups/new.html.haml#L26](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/groups/new.html.haml#L26)                                                      |
| HAML   | data-attributes (literal) | [app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L117](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L117)                     | [app/views/shared/issuable/_sidebar_assignees.html.haml#L59](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/shared/issuable/_sidebar_assignees.html.haml#L59)                              |
| HAML   | helper                    | [app/helpers/tracking_helper.rb](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/helpers/tracking_helper.rb)                              | [app/views/layouts/header/_default.html.haml#L11](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/layouts/header/_default.html.haml#L11)                                         |
| Raw JS | class                     | [app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L106](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/tracking.js#L106)             | [app/assets/javascripts/design_management/utils/tracking.js#L32](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/design_management/utils/tracking.js#L32)                          |

title: FE: Allow customers to extend or reactivate their trial on gitlab.com
description:
This is the ~frontend issue for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/290278

### Design

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/290284

### Development plan

| Task | MR |
| ------ | ------ |
| Create a small Vue component that can be rendered as a standalone app rendering a button that displays a modal with `Cancel` and `[Extend/Reactivate]` actions. This component needs these fields: `namespace_id` and `trial_extension_type`, `namespace.can_extend?`, `namespace.can_reactivate?`, and `extend_reactivate_trials_path`. **We should _not_ include the `glm_params`.** |  |
| Render the component in the [subscription_table](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/billings/subscriptions/components/subscription_table.vue) and mount a minimal app rendering the same thing the [billing_plan_header](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/views/shared/billings/_billing_plan_header.html.haml) | |

### Availability & Testing

<!-- This section needs to be retained and filled in during the workflow planning breakdown phase of this feature proposal, if not earlier.

What risks does this change pose to our availability? How might it affect the quality of the product? What additional test coverage or changes to tests will be needed? Will it require cross-browser testing?

Please list the test areas (unit, integration and end-to-end) that needs to be added or updated to ensure that this feature will work as intended. Please use the list below as guidance.
* Unit test changes
* Integration test changes
* End-to-end test change

See the test engineering planning process and reach out to your counterpart Software Engineer in Test for assistance: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/test-engineering/#test-planning -->

This change will require Vue frontend specs to assert the operability of the new Vue component. 

- Cancel button works
- Validation of each field and their permutations

Additionally a feature spec should be written to test the billing plan header renders the component and works through the feature flow.

description:
## Summary

In https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4547 we have created a single members list where namespace owners can view their billable members. In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/301232 we have created a feature to allow namespace owners to remove members in a single motion from all appearances within the namespace (subgroups/projects).

This iteration provides more details about the members in the list which will provide useful insight to namespace owners.

## Proposal

Add the expand/collapse feature along with the columns of data as depicted in the [designs](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/217851/designs/Iteration2___Seat_usage_list_v2.png#note_510397627)

1. [ ] Create the ability to expand/collapse member details
1. [ ] Display all group/subgroup/project affiliations per member in the expanded details
1. [ ] Display columns: `Access granted` date, `Access expires` date, `Role`, `Last activity` date

title: Increase maximum number of dotenv variables (again)
description:
<!-- This template is a great use for issues that are feature::additions or technical tasks for larger issues.-->

### Proposal 

I just bumped into the limit in the number of variables one can export through a dotenv artifact. I noticed a similar issue exists here: #247913 and was resolved when the limit was raised from 10 to 20 variables.

Alas, I need 30 to 40 of these variables: I'm using [GitVersion](https://github.com/GitTools/GitVersion) to generate my application's version information. Here is an example output of this tool:

```ini
GitVersion_Major=1
GitVersion_Minor=0
GitVersion_Patch=6
GitVersion_PreReleaseTag=playing-with-gitlab.31
GitVersion_PreReleaseTagWithDash=-playing-with-gitlab.31
GitVersion_PreReleaseLabel=playing-with-gitlab
GitVersion_PreReleaseLabelWithDash=-playing-with-gitlab
GitVersion_PreReleaseNumber=31
GitVersion_WeightedPreReleaseNumber=31
GitVersion_BuildMetaData=
GitVersion_BuildMetaDataPadded=
GitVersion_FullBuildMetaData=Branch.playing-with-gitlab.Sha.4a410948ccd311e02b52a66af36fcab24edcef6f
GitVersion_MajorMinorPatch=1.0.6
GitVersion_SemVer=1.0.6-playing-with-gitlab.31
GitVersion_LegacySemVer=1.0.6-playing-with-gitla31
GitVersion_LegacySemVerPadded=1.0.6-playing-with-git0031
GitVersion_AssemblySemVer=1.0.6.0
GitVersion_AssemblySemFileVer=1.0.6.0
GitVersion_FullSemVer=1.0.6-playing-with-gitlab.31
GitVersion_InformationalVersion=1.0.6-playing-with-gitlab.31+Branch.playing-with-gitlab.Sha.4a410948ccd311e02b52a66af36fcab24edcef6f
GitVersion_BranchName=playing_with_gitlab
GitVersion_EscapedBranchName=playing-with-gitlab
GitVersion_Sha=4a410948ccd311e02b52a66af36fcab24edcef6f
GitVersion_ShortSha=4a41094
GitVersion_NuGetVersionV2=1.0.6-playing-with-git0031
GitVersion_NuGetVersion=1.0.6-playing-with-git0031
GitVersion_NuGetPreReleaseTagV2=playing-with-git0031
GitVersion_NuGetPreReleaseTag=playing-with-git0031
GitVersion_VersionSourceSha=45fd1cec8cfcebb52d45d60bf19b976162dd0bfe
GitVersion_CommitsSinceVersionSource=31
GitVersion_CommitsSinceVersionSourcePadded=0031
GitVersion_UncommittedChanges=1
GitVersion_CommitDate=2021-02-12
```

As a workaround, I'm currently cherry picking some of these variables for exposition through artifacts so as not to exceed the limit. However, this means I must maintain the list of variables to keep and this makes the build script more complex than required.

I wonder if this *20* limits could be raised to say, 50 or 100 variables, or no limit at all (and maybe raise the file size limit as well ton be consistent)?


### Proposed solution

Let's increase our maximum number to the following: `50` for FREE, `100` for EEP, `150` for EEU.

title: license-finder's build-conan-pkg job fails
description:
### Summary

The [`build-conan-pkg` job](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/blob/main/.gitlab/build.yml) of [license-finder](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder) fails because the Conan user name is invalid (too long).

There seems to be other issues, and changing the user name to something shorter doesn't fix the issue. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/merge_requests/26

### Further details

`build-conan-pkg` is used to create a test package named `example/0.1`, and to push it to the Conan package registry of the `license-finder` project. It's been failing since [license-management](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/license-management) was renamed to [license-finder](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/license-finder).

The failing job only impacts the testing of `license-finder`, and it should have no direct impact on users.

The integration test that uses the test Conan package is `pending`. See [`integration-c` job](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/jobs/990706139#L1580):

```
Pending: (Failures listed here are expected and do not affect your suite's status)
  1) conan when pulling packages from a custom conan remote is expected to contain exactly "example"
     # No reason given
     Failure/Error: expect(subject.dependency_names).to match_array(['example'])
       expected collection contained:  ["example"]
       actual collection contained:    []
       the missing elements were:      ["example"]
     # ./spec/integration/c/conan_spec.rb:98:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
```

### Steps to reproduce

Trigger a new pipeline for the [license-finder](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/license-finder) project.


### What is the current *bug* behavior?

job fails

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

job should push the `example/0.1` package to the Conan package registry of the license-finder project
 
### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/jobs/776426170

```
ERROR: Value provided for user name, 'gitlab-org+security-products+analyzers+license-finder' (type str), is too long. Valid names must contain at most 51 characters.
```

### Possible fixes

Fix `script` of the [`build-conan-pkg` job](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/blob/main/.gitlab/build.yml)

1. Replace [NAMESPACE](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/blob/main/.gitlab/build.yml#L7) with a shorter string.
1. Run tests and ensure that the job pass
 
/cc @brytannia @gonzoyumo

title: Gitpod link in User Preferences
description:
### Summary When Gitpod is enabled on a self-hosted GitLab instance an Integrations section is added to the User Preferences page. There a link to Gitpod is available. This however points to the [gitpod.io](https://gitpod.io) public instance rather than the configured on-prem instance. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Enable Gitpod in GitLab Admin. 1. Configure Gitpod URL to something other than `https://gitpod.io`, like `https://code.gitlab.example.com`. 1. Visit User Preferences page. 1. Click the Gitpod link and have the `gitpod.io` page be opened in a new window instead of `code.gitlab.example.com`. ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Link always points to `gitpod.io`. ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Link should point to the configured Gitpod instance. #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

System information
System:
Proxy:          no
Current User:   git

title: [CI Minutes] Create a banner to display success from purchasing CI Minutes
description:
Create a banner to display success from purchasing CI Minutes.

### Criteria

||
|-|
|![ci-purchase-banner](/uploads/47436940379f5392d8007405edeef91a/ci-purchase-banner.png)|

The banner should
- use the `GlAlert` component
- be of type `success`
- be dismissible
- have title: `Thanks for your purchase!`
- have content: `You have successfully purchased CI minutes. You'll receive a receipt by mail.`

### Implementation plan

|||
|-|-|
| Add ~backend preparatory logic and banner | gitlab-org/gitlab!66901 |
| Add ~frontend logic to show banner after successful purchase | gitlab-org/gitlab!66451 |

title: [CI Minutes] Create details and summary components for CI Minutes
description:
Create details and summary components for CI Minutes. This can be inspired by [`subscription_details.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/subscriptions/new/components/checkout/subscription_details.vue) and [`summary_details.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/subscriptions/new/components/order_summary/summary_details.vue)
 - User should be able to change the quantity in the details component and invalid quantity values are not allowed
Details in the Epic: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5391

title: [CI Minutes] Create new components that uses a local GraphQL state in for order and payments
description:
Create new components that uses a [local GraphQL state](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/fe_guide/graphql.html#local-state-with-apollo) in stead of [`payment_method.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/subscriptions/new/components/checkout/payment_method.vue), [`zuora.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/subscriptions/new/components/checkout/zuora.vue), [`billing_address.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/subscriptions/new/components/checkout/billing_address.vue) and [`confirm_order.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/subscriptions/new/components/checkout/confirm_order.vue).
 - Ensure that any error is displayed within the flow and not after redirecting (as the current subscription flow does)
 - Ensure that input fields have accessible names. See [this source](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/58651#note_545827868) for more details

Details in the Epic: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5391

title: Create end point for assigning project to execution policy
description:
### Problem to solve 

Users should be able to select which policy should be applied to which project. We created db model to hold this information but we don't have end point for users to assing policy to project.

### Intended users

* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)

### User experience goal

Security Analyst will go to Security & Complience -> Policies and select policy from dropdown. That policy will apply to the project.

### Implementation plan

- [x] Create controller scaffolding
- [x] Create service that assigns policy to project
- [x] Connect controller with service and the view
 
### Available Tier

~"GitLab Ultimate" 

### Links / references

https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5329

epic.title: MVC: Project-level DAST Scan Execution Policies (pipeline)

title: Support slide animation on settings_block component
description:
The following discussion from !53975 should be addressed:

- [ ] @jiaan started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/53975#note_507866386): 

    > **Nitpick (non-blocking):** WDYT about giving this setting block a slide animation? The other settings on this page slides out, but this one just pops. Looking at [`setting_block.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/b05afd5edb18f9dc751e2f1f0a9ba5a9121a45a9/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/settings/settings_block.vue#L31) the class `no-animate` is hardcoded when it would need to be an optional prop. If we wanted to go forward with this I think it would make sense to do so as a follow-up.
    > 
    > ![Kapture_2021-02-12_at_14.21.21](/uploads/087989696319a59412661b79a8f2d903/Kapture_2021-02-12_at_14.21.21.gif)
